reviews.text: Honestly one of my favourite places to visit in Seoul. The air felt so refreshing here knowing you have a city that never sleeps outside these palace walls. Walking around the palace was a nice and calm activity.

I went early in the morning and was able to avoid the crowds and I caught the guard ceremony.  Beautiful grounds and buildings to learn about the history of Korea.   The juxtaposition of this historic palace against the modern, bustling skyline of Seoul was a wonderful experience.

It's a straightforward, traditional Korean Palace. It was nice to read its history - it's already been restored twice after the Japanese destroyed it in the 1500s and 1915! Appreciate all the work to restore and maintain it!

One of the most well-known attraction in Seoul which is worth a quick visit. In the palace itself there isn’t much to do apart from just walking around and seeing the historic buildings. You also can’t enter any of the buildings which means it can be quite hot in the summer. Personally, I would just do a quick walk around of the palace then head to the two museums either side of the palace as there’s a lot more to see there. The entry fee is quite reasonable and there’s also discounts available.

When you enter this palace from the front gate, you will see 3 large buildings. The area of this 3 buildings will be very crowded. The  first is the gate next to the road, then the gate 2, and the main building. Near the main building you can turn to the east side through a small door you will enter the area of the kingdom that is vast, quiet, and beautiful more suitable if you want to take pictures, not many people enter into this side

Best destination in Seoul ever!! There are many trails that you can take here and most of the trails lead you to amazing destinations. The effort to reach those destinations is high but the panoramic views are well worth every steps you took.

We took the hard trail to go to Baekundae peak and it was tough. However, the experience was something that we will never forget!
great hiking and scenery. Peaceful. AFAIK, it's a completely healthy and wholesome day out in nature.
AWESOME!!!
The views are amazing, the trails make you work for them too. There's an occasional water fountain on the trails and some pretty temples. My only gripe is why so many rocks on the trail?

I must agree with reviews below that this mountain is gorgeous! I was hiking to Baekundae and made a choice for a hard trail. I have to admit it was really a hard trail and in fact, I was literally climbing sometimes. 🙂 Finally, the breathtaking view was worth it!
I went to the Mount Uisangbong another day (it was a hard trail again). Amazing views were thoughout my hiking and as a result, I really enjoyed this hike.
If you visit Seoul and you like hiking, you might go to both of the places. 💪

Approx 40% of the shops was close but still good for shopping and chilling.
Some street foods sold here but not much.
Best  halal lamb and chicken roll in seoul.although meyongdong steet is really full of streetfood.you can find different type of food  like squid chips,Turkish icecream and more
Always a great place for shopping
It's an experience without all the people....
Really dead unfortunately due to Covid-19

It is an amazing palace in the middle of very busy Seoul. If you take the guided tour - you won’t regret it. Our guide spoke perfect English and was full with fun facts and intriguing stories. A must do when in Seoul!
Try to visit in the autumn. Simple breathtaking and serene. Could easily spend half a day strolling through here, contemplating, people watching, etc.
Beautiful traditional palace in Seoul, South Korea - a walk can take about 1-2 hours depending on how far you want to go. The place is clean and family-friendly

One of the historical palace and landmark in Seoul.
Wonderful view, the palace area is really huge, intricately beautiful architecture.
We really enjoy our time here, plenty spaces to sit and relax.

Really nice place to visit and the palace is so big. Lots of things to learn about Korean culture and their king. There were separate houses for different purposes for king. I was searching for the place where the king used to smoke. Bad luck may be he was non smoker , so I had to go out for a smoke.

Grand hall that demonstrates people's relentless efforts to protect their home and their country.
Considering what is going on in Afghanistan I realized how important is for every citizen to have ownership of their own country.
I will visit again and I plan to spend a couple of hours to grasp all valuable lessons from the past history.

More than just the Korean war- includes artifacts and information throughout the centuries from all of the different dynasties. Be sure to check out the aircraft and tanks on the outside. If you're in to history this is a worthwhile museum! Also has a nice cafe to get a snack and cold drink.
Really amazing place, much too see and do. Free entry for so much! A great day full of I information and history.

Great place to walk around outside. There are many planes and helicopters to come close to.
I haven't visited the museum yet due to COVID restrictions but I understood it to be huge and informative.

Amazing and free much like the museums in London. This facility is top notch with detailed history of the Korean peninsula essentially from ancient times to present. It would be easy to spend a few days here and still not comprehend all the details. This is a place of reverence and honor for the Korean people's the heroism is humbling. Strongly recommended.

Fantastic museum that always has wonderful displays. Whenever a new teacher comes to Korea, this is one of the places I bring them to. The pond is pretty and there are plenty of places for great pictures. The artifacts are largely explained in English and Korean, and the rotating exhibits means there's usually something new for me to see and I've been here about 10 times now.

If you go, make sure you go see the Buddhist hanging scrolls. Truly awe inspiring.

This is an absolutely massive world class museum. Everybody that's visiting Seoul should put time aside to come visit this place. Ichon subway station gets you inside from the station directly. Best part about this museum is that it's FREE, except the special seasonal exhibits. It's also indoors with nice AC, so an ideal place for families during Seoul's crazy hot summer days. At 8 pm they have a really nice free light show at the pagoda. Highly recommend this place, you won't be disappointed.

It is free and was more interesting for foreigner then folk museum. But there should be more information in English. There is a perfect shop with souvenirs. Don’t miss the walking around the park. It’s so beautiful!

The general admission gallery (on the east side) is free.

The first floor is dedicated to Korean history.  There are many artifacts and interesting immersive digital display rooms.  The textual descriptions and introductions to the rooms are multilingual (Korean, English, Chinese and Japanese).  The second floor has a large collection of calligraphy/brush art and ceramics.  The third floor has guest collections.
Great museum quite compact beautiful gardens and well thought out displays. The restaurant was situated down and great food well priced. I fell in love with the room of quiet contemplation

candidates.formatted_address: South Korea, Seoul, Songpa-gu, Olympic-ro, 300 지하1층
candidates.name: LOTTE World Aquarium, Seoul

reviews.text: Hands down one of our favorite experiences in Seoul!  The sky experience has been well thought out to create a memory that will last a lifetime!  We loved seeing the views from each floor and our 4 year old loved being able to stop for chocolate ice cream!  We enjoyed the photo ops along the way and felt the prices were fair for printing the photos we loved!  We appreciated the speedy elevator too.  A great experience!

Its a jaw dropping building.. in the core of city..Its Korea's Tallest observation deck, and 5th in the world with 23 stories.. with all the urban facilities/ amenities...all the famous brands outlets...its shiny like anything... very neat...the building look like from fairytale...The architecture is stellar and amazing! This is a must visit spot if you are in this area..Very great tourist destination. overall view of Seoul it’s amazing and breathtaking if you are nor scared of height...Great shopping place and great tourist spot!!

The view from the top is amazing. I was excited to be at the top of South Korea's tallest building.
The entry to the tower is also an awesome experience, I liked the way they presented its history.
Then the lift ride was fascinating with the visuals. At the top here comes the Seoul city view with the Han river. At 550m height, the experience is really worth it.
Don't miss it.

For discount book your tickets online in advance.

Amazing! By far the best observation tower I have ever gone up. The views of Seoul were breathtaking. Very spacious at the top and somehow we spent more than an hour up there. If you want to have dinner at the very top, around ₩50,000 per person, make sure you make a reservation in advance.

Recently renovated so the rooms are in great shape. Great service general and executive lounge happy hour offers decent drinks and food. Swimming pool honors club members more than the hotel guests though. Not a family vacation place with little kids.

candidates.formatted_address: 2 Sejong-daero 18-gil, Sogong-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul, South Korea
candidates.name: Seoul Station (Subway)

reviews.text: Mostly clean and convenient place. There is very helpful guidance in the station, specially for foreigners, including Internet facilities. There are many shops with 24x7 service. Trains arriving as scheduled and people who work there are very kind and respectful for Passengers. Highly recommend place and transportation method if in Korea.

In terms of importance and carrying capacity of passenger, Seoul station is the biggest one in S.Korea. So very crowded place and a strainger like you maybe having difficulty to buy a train ticket, a subway ticket and find a platform to ride a express train bound for Busan, and/or subway line1, line4, airport railway, etc. There are many facilities for travelers, i.e., train ticket machines, free restrooms, restaurants, convenience stores and shopping centers.
Further, you can use airport railways bound for Incheon international airport. Railroad police officers are patrolling for safety purposes and it has a service lounge for ROK and US armed forces as well.
Considering that Seoul station is so crowded place especially for Monday, weekends and holidays, sometimes you cannot get tickets that you want. Make a reservation in advance by using an Korail app. Please be there earlier and study faithfully to have a comfortable trip. Good luck.
I had to get out of Seoul for the weekend so I departed from Seoul Station 서울역. It’s fun here. It’s busy, but efficient. Get a quick bite, buy some gifts, or wander the Kakao Store while you wait.

Very clean and well kept.

I would avoid purchasing anything because it's a little more expensive, but aside from that, it's very efficient and easy to navigate.
Main train station in Seoul. Practically, you can go any place you want to go in Korea.

candidates.formatted_address: 2 Sejong-daero 18-gil, Sogong-dong, Jung-gu, Seoul, South Korea
candidates.name: Seoul Station (Subway)

reviews.text: Mostly clean and convenient place. There is very helpful guidance in the station, specially for foreigners, including Internet facilities. There are many shops with 24x7 service. Trains arriving as scheduled and people who work there are very kind and respectful for Passengers. Highly recommend place and transportation method if in Korea.

In terms of importance and carrying capacity of passenger, Seoul station is the biggest one in S.Korea. So very crowded place and a strainger like you maybe having difficulty to buy a train ticket, a subway ticket and find a platform to ride a express train bound for Busan, and/or subway line1, line4, airport railway, etc. There are many facilities for travelers, i.e., train ticket machines, free restrooms, restaurants, convenience stores and shopping centers.
Further, you can use airport railways bound for Incheon international airport. Railroad police officers are patrolling for safety purposes and it has a service lounge for ROK and US armed forces as well.
Considering that Seoul station is so crowded place especially for Monday, weekends and holidays, sometimes you cannot get tickets that you want. Make a reservation in advance by using an Korail app. Please be there earlier and study faithfully to have a comfortable trip. Good luck.
I had to get out of Seoul for the weekend so I departed from Seoul Station 서울역. It’s fun here. It’s busy, but efficient. Get a quick bite, buy some gifts, or wander the Kakao Store while you wait.

Very clean and well kept.

I would avoid purchasing anything because it's a little more expensive, but aside from that, it's very efficient and easy to navigate.
Main train station in Seoul. Practically, you can go any place you want to go in Korea.

We went to the park during summer. Hot but bearable. A lot of shades and spacious. You will pass by the park to go to E-land Cruise jetty. There are people chilling under the bridge and there are people busking late evening, bring your own chair, mat, drinks, tables and food. Just make sure to clean up. There are a lot of places to picnic around the park.

So our family originally came here for the boat tour. The boat ride was a slow trip up and down the Han river with many photo opportunities and seagulls, lots of seagulls. There was also live music, which was basically one woman with a guitar singing popular songs with a heavy accent. It was kind of entertaining. After the tour we rented some bikes and road along the river. At the center of the park is the famous Seoul sign with the city behind it. There's also lot's of grass areas to pitch a tent and relax, though camping overnight is forbidden and carries a heavy fine. Don't forget to stop at the many food vendors along the bike trail. The CU has a few hot water stations outside along with microwaves to warm up your noodles. There's also a restaurant attached with outdoor seating and really good fried chicken. We really need to go back and explore more, twice is not enough. Even with COVID we still were able to enjoy the activities and peaceful atmosphere. On a side note I would recommend taking the Han river tour at night if you can.
It is good place for a rest. It has wide river side park and cycle road. You can rent bicycle. You can eat very delicious street foods.

This is a nust visit place if you ever come to Korea. It is a big place and you can come here with your partner, friends or family. The sunset is especially beautiful. Although there are lot of people around, there are a lot if picnic spots. Special photo spots are made for couples to make the visit memorable. Apart from this, there are soooo many street food stores, convenient stores and restaurants to enjoy the beautiful view with food. There are cafes and restaurants floating on the water too. Make sure to go in your best attire to click as many pictures as you can.

Nice place to spend evening time with cool breeze. We can rent carpet, table and chair.. Plenty of eateries are present around.. Vegetarians get your own food. You can also go and experience cruise ride along Han River which needs tickets to be booked in advance. If you like to walk, it is a place to visit. As it has good walking track along the river. You can see amazing sky colours at sunset which will be definitely refreshing.

Was an absolutely gorgeous day for visiting the Tower. It was so sunny and clear that when we reached the top we could see everything. The views are spectacular and I loved the added extra bonus of having place names written on the windows with how far away they were. Both my friend and I found the capital cities of our home countries. There is plenty to do around the base of the Tower as well. A few restaurants (although if you're Vegetarian you might struggle to find anything without meat), cafes and convenient stores for you to get food. Plenty of little craft and trinket stalls as well as a few local food stalls. I even got my portrait drawn and framed for 50,000₩ as a birthday gift to myself. I would also recommend couples to go visit. You can buy (or bring) a padlock which you can write a little message on and add it to the 1000s of other padlock that line the walkways and railings all around the Tower. It really is a beautiful sight to see. Plenty of aesthetic photo opportunities too if you're more about that Insta Life. Overall, I would totally recommend you put this on your list of places to visit in Korea.

One of the hallmarks of Seoul, a beautiful tower. Getting here is part of the experience - you can either take a bus or cable car. The path to the tower is amazing, and you can admire great views of the city even before reaching the tower. There is a nice seating area near the tower to just relax. I could not go up the tower as I arrived before the opening time, but nevertheless, I would recommend everyone visiting Seoul to check out the N Seoul Tower.

Wonderful experience, especially after taking the cable car up (much needed after a full day of hiking in the mountains!) Recommend coming around sunset to better appreciate the scenery. Plenty of signs for English speakers. Don't forget to buy a lock and leave your mark! We very much enjoyed seeing Seoul at night; the city is vibrant and alive.

Got there at dusk. By the time we got into the tower and up to the top it was dark out. It would have been better to get there earlier to see the foothills etc, but time and buses wouldn't allow it. But it was a stunning view of the city😍 Also, its hard to take pics from the windows as they have too many lights on in the shops behind so there is a glare off the window. Again, stunning view but best to go in daylight. 😊

I had a "speedy" experience while visiting this place because it's already late at night and I just manage to see things and do some window shopping inside the tower. Overall, this place is totally nice if you come in the day. At night, yes you can see night view from the tower (and it's really beautiful) but you gonna feel a bit rush because of the buses 😂 (unless you arrive at the place from 6pm). I only know you can go up there by bus, so of course you have to take the bus to go downtown.

I really wish I could visit this place again :)

Beautiful park with several little trails you can take. Many of the trails offer both ramps and stairs, and there are plenty of seated areas, restrooms, and water springs along the way. There is even a bus that will pick you up on the main road and cable cars and a gift shop once you get to the tower.

I am not quite sure about the history of this exact place. But one thing I am sure of Namsan is a very important location during the revolution of democracy.
Other than that, it attracts a lot of tourists even the locals here. Saw around 4 stalls on the foot of the tower who draws portrait of people.
Wonderful place, worths a visit👍🏻
Numsan Mountain Park, breathtaking, and Seoul views.
Lock your love 🔐💝😁

candidates.formatted_address: South Korea, Seoul, Jung-gu, Myeongdong-gil, 26 유네스코회관
candidates.name: Myeongdong NANTA Theatre

reviews.text: Simply put, this show was AMAZING! I loved it and every single Korean I've mentioned it to reports having seen it at one point or another. It's non-verbal so language isn't an issue, but it's hilarious with some slapstick comedy, fake romance, amazing tricks like spinning knives, there's a little bit of audience participation, dazzling light shows, acrobatic, and of course it's musical the whole time. Basically it has everything you could think of! Definitely worth it! Don't miss it!
Good family-oriented show. Musical action-packed comedy centering around a company and it's chefs preparing a wedding feast. No need to know Korean to understand and enjoy show.

It was impossible to book a ticket.  Tried with Korean credit cards, then errors out saying I logged out.  Tried with a US card then it says I cannot use my Visa card. (Chase). Called to see if I can book over the phone.  They said I cannot do that and I will have to pay full price at the gate if I want to buy a ticket even though they have summer special discount available online.

There are so many security features to purchase tickets, including having to have a mobile phone number. The Korean company that handles the transactions - KG INICIS - does not permit the use of Canadian credit cards. So, cannot buy tickets. It looks like the don't want you to see the show.

You have to register first before you can book (annoying).  But worst of all, the payment gateway for international credit cards blocks halfway through the payment process, and half of the stuff is in Korean!  And yes, I tried several times.

I decided to go to the ticket office in advance, explain the situation and book on-site.

The show itself was hilarious!  I'm often skeptical about such more popular shows, but this one truly deserves to be in everyone's to-do list when in Seoul.
You don't need to understand Korean because it's conceived as a theatre piece without words.  Brilliant, funny and impressive.

One of the most stunning things in the world. A beautiful tribute to the citizens of Seoul. As a foreigner it was such a special place to visit. Relaxing and serene whereby locals go out for late night walks and runs. The stream is also decorated and looks absolutely amazing during the Buddhas birthday.

Absolutely love this place. Came here twice in the evenings during my stay in Seoul to stroll this amazing area. Excellent atmosphere with people walking around or sitting. Definitely worth a visit when you are in Seoul. Come in the evening during and after sunset.
Beautiful place to stroll through at night when the lights are all lit up. You can soak your feet in the stream and cool off if you go in the day time too. Definitely check this place out in Seoul.
Beautiful walk along canal. Done both in morning and evening. Amazing and really recommend. Also done the complete walk from Han River to end, so much nature and things to see.

After hectic day just a coffee and me relaxing time.this place gives a peace of mind.you can enjoy with your love one.keep in mind that alcohol and swimming in not allowed.best place for relaxation with scenery. Perfect

A tranquil and calming place in the heart of the busy Seoul city. This is the main temple of the Jogyesa order. Had a chance to go there on the occasion of Buddha’s birthday. The temple premises was well decorated with colorful lanterns. And the hymns of the prayer songs made this place divine.

I went during the lotus festival,bat night, it was gorgeous. It felt very welcoming and it is open 24 hours according to a 'Temple Stay' pamphlet. (You can also do a temple stay-. I had considered it, maybe my next trip to Seoul)
The temple in Seoul. The priests are gentle. For Indians, if have visited any Buddhist Temple in India, will feel like the home here. Even the priests and other staff will greet saying 'Namaste'.
We walked upon a ceremony in progress and sat down and enjoyed it.  Beautiful  spot with all the lanterns up.  Could only imagine  what it would look like at night with every thing lit up.

Temple had 3 gigantic statues of Buddha in different sitting posture, Temple's staff were helpful. I was not able to see the decoration because I think they just started to decorate the temple, when I went there. You can have temple food in a restaurant located inside the premises of temple.

Wonderful Buddhist temple, garden are very big and there is so many place to stop praying or mediate! There is also a place to drink tea and where u can also buy the leaf. Other good information tea ceremony is available only Thursday between 2pm and 4pm

Add this to your must-visit places in Seoul when you come here. Anybody who is spiritual may indeed find this place has powerful caring energies. Whether you are a Buddhist or not, highly recommend you visit. For Buddhists who would like to pray, they provide huge areas in front of both the 23 meter tall statue and the pagoda with the smaller seated sculptures. They provide comfy prayer cushion mats for anyone who wants to pray.
Enrolled in a day temple life experience. Very welcoming staffs and interesting activities. Recommended for travellers that dont have time for the 2 days 1 night program.
As per history, this temple was built in 794. This temple is opposite the Coex mall in Seoul. The ambiance of the temple is great. Here they offer temple stay also.
Quite cool to see something like this traditional beautiful temple right in the beating heart of Seoul. It was more interesting than I thought it would be.

A lot of effort to climb the stairs but gorgeous views of Seoul once you're up there. We also saw a deer, which jumped out of the tall grass and terrified us, and some cute baby pheasants. The silver grass festival is especially good there.

Very nice view. The day was clear the place packed. A nice place for a walk. A warning: Too many couples endlessly taking pictures. Either dont care at all and keep walking or care and be interrupted constantly.
Best place for family, you can jog from the entrance or go for a ride for 150 PHP per person and per way

There are awesome place.
Fresh air on the top and good coffee.

Conveniently located in the World Cup park, it is a nice park to take pictures especially in autumn. There are a set of stairs to climb to the top, otherwise you can walk along the road or take a paid tram (though there were many people waiting in line). The park is located on a former landfill and offers striking views of Seoul. Be warned that weekends are crowded especially during autumn. As such, it can get noisy.

Very nice view with Korean cultural heritage and buildings. The surrounding area is walkable, there are a lot of eateries too. You can rent hanbok if you want, it is provided near the main road, and you can take a lot of pictures in every corner. I bought waffle ice cream and it is nice to accompany your summer day

I nice place to visit a short walk from Seoul Royal Palace (Gyeongbokgung). There isn’t much but still quite worth seeing.

To get to the main photogenic spot keep walking straight into the alley from the map marker where you go quite a bit up hill. There’s also maps around the area that guide you though a route through multiple villages in the same area if you wish to see more.

There’s a traditional dress (both men and women) rental shop down the road from the entrance to the alley which is quite a popular thing for tourists to do.

Literally, a living historic village. Take a walk back in time and roam around the small short hills of this ancient village. There's this uncanny blend of current living with historic culture. Short walking distance away are the two largest palaces in Seoul. Several awesome cafes nearby as well.

Cool old part of the city. We didn’t have much time here and it was just really hot. We also had a stroller with two kids and it was a lot of walking and hills. The neighborhood is really cool though! I would love to come back and take pics while wearing a hanbok.
Scenic street in the bustling city of Seoul. I love the traditional architect mixed with a tad of trendy, modern-ness. Hidden alleys and gems all the way, every turn and corner is a surprise.

Crazy and funny place, full of shops and cafes selling almost everything. When the sun goes down, it gets even more interesting with all the neon lights on, and the music everywhere. Totally worth a visit!
Busking has left now but still energetic. Many good places to eat and shop.
Lively after 3pm. Many young people, a different vibe.
Busy street, nice for strolling around and shopping (especially clothes)
Good for young people...a lot of changes compares to my 20s.
